markdown: <::engraving: An angel-like figure with wings, draped in cloth, is seated on a rectangular pedestal. The figure is blowing a long, slender trumpet held to its mouth. Below the pedestal, on the ground, are several objects: an open book, a quill pen, an inkwell, a rolled-up scroll with writing, a staff resembling a caduceus, a closed book or box, and a laurel wreath. The letter "W" is visible to the right of the angel's head.:> W WISDOM WISDOM MAGAZINE WISDOM BOOKS WISDOM ENCYCLOPEDIA Published by The Wisdom Society for the Advancement of Knowledge, Learning and Research in Education A Non-Profit Educational Publishing Institution 9107 Wilshire Boulevard, Beverly Hills, California LEON GUTTERMAN President, Editor & Publisher EMINENT RECIPIENTS OF THE WISDOM AWARD OF HONOR DEAN ACHESON MORTIMER J. ADLER BERNARD M. BARUCH SAMUEL BELKIN WILLIAM BENTON IRVING BERLIN LEONARD BERNSTEIN EUGENE R. BLACK HUGO L. BLACK CHARLES BOYER GEN. OMAR N. BRADLEY WILLIAM J. BRENNAN JR. KINGMAN BREWSTER JR. DAVID BRINKLEY PEARL S. BUCK RALPH J. BUNCHE ADM. ARLEIGH BURKE FRANK CAPRA BENNETT CERF NORMAN CHANDLER WINSTON S. CHURCHILL GEN. MARK W. CLARK TOM C. CLARK GEN. LUCIUS D. CLAY JAMES B. DUBRIDGE WILL DURANT ALBERT EINSTEIN DWIGHT D. EISENHOWER LEONARD K. FIRESTONE DR. MORRIS FISHBEIN HENRY FORD II HARRY EMERSON FOSDICK FELIX FRANKFURTER ROBERT FROST GEORGE GALLUP JOHN W. GARDNER ARTHUR J. GOLDBERG KATHARINE GRAHAM CARY GRANT WALTER GROPIUS MELVILLE B. GROSVENOR GEN. ALFRED GRUENTHER JOHN GUNTHER JOHN M. HARLAN W. AVERELL HARRIMAN WILLIAM R. HEARST JR. JASCHA HEIFETZ ANDREW HEISKELL ERNEST HEMINGWAY CHARLTON HESTON CONRAD N. HILTON PAUL G. HOFFMAN J. EDGAR HOOVER BOB HOPE HUBERT H. HUMPHREY DR. CARL G. JUNG HENRY J. KAISER ELIA KAZAN HELEN KELLER JOHN F. KENNEDY ROBERT F. KENNEDY GRAYSON L. KIRK STANLEY KRAMER EDWIN H. LAND ROBERT LEHMAN GODDARD LIEBERSON WALTER LIPPMANN HENRY CABOT LODGE HENRY R. LUCE GEN. DOUGLAS MACARTHUR FREDRIC MARCH GEN. GEORGE C. MARSHALL THURGOOD MARSHALL DR. FELIX MARTI-IBANEZ Dear Dr. Shank: July 5, 1969 We take pleasure in notifying you, on the occasion of our 15th Anniversary, that you have been judged worthy of high honor. In appreciation of your notable accomplishments, meritorious achievement and, because you are to the best of our knowledge, a man of superior intelligence, high idealism and reputation who appreciates the value of education, you are eligible for distinguished recognition. You have been nominated by the Board of Editors of Wisdom and deemed worthy of being an Eminent Recipient of the 1969 Wisdom Award Of Honor. Upon election, your name will be placed in the Wisdom Hall Of Fame in which the names of the greatest and most notable men of our time are inscribed---renowned, respected and admired men of greatness in all professions and fields of endeavor who are Eminent Recipients (see attached pages). Upon your acceptance of nomination and following your election to the Wisdom Hall Of Fame, The Wisdom Society will confer on you the 1969 Wisdom Award, inscribed with your name, an honor of great prestige value that you will treasure for a lifetime and for future generations. A reply card and return envelope are enclosed for your convenience, to acknowledge your acceptance of nomination, to confirm your approval of election to the Wisdom Hall Of Fame, and to express your wish to be an Eminent Recipient of the 1969 Wisdom Award. An immediate response will be appreciated by the Board of Editors. With highest esteem, Most sincerely yours, <::attestation: Signature Signed Signature: legible Handwritten signature of Leon Gutterman positioned below the salutation and above the typed name and title.::> Leon Gutterman President and Publisher EMINENT RECIPIENTS OF THE WISDOM AWARD OF HONOR W. SOMERSET MAUGHAM DR. CHARLES W. MAYO GEN. JOHN P. MCCONNELL ROBERT S. MCNAMARA MARGARET MEAD PAUL MELLON DR. KARL MENNINGER DAVID MERRICK ARTHUR MILLER DR. FRANKLIN D. MURPHY EDWARD R. She is blowing a long, slender trumpet held to her mouth. At her feet, various objects representing arts and sciences are scattered, including a painter's palette with brushes, a sculpted head, musical instruments (like a flute or recorder), and books or scrolls. : figure::> 969 956 61 62

We take pleasure in notifying you, on the occasion of our 15th Anniversary, that you have been judged worthy of high honor. In appreciation of your notable accomplishments, meritorious achievement and, because you are to the best of our knowledge, a man of superior intelligence, high idealism and reputation who appreciates the value of education, you are eligible for distinguished recognition.

You have been nominated by the Board of Editors of Wisdom and deemed worthy of being an Eminent Recipient of the 1969 Wisdom Award Of Honor. Upon election, your name will be placed in the Wisdom Hall Of Fame in which the names of the greatest and most notable men of our time are inscribed---renowned, respected and admired men of greatness in all professions and fields of endeavor who are Eminent Recipients (see attached pages).

Upon your acceptance of nomination and following your election to the Wisdom Hall Of Fame, The Wisdom Society will confer on you the 1969 Wisdom Award, inscribed with your name, an honor of great prestige value that you will treasure for a lifetime and for future generations.

A reply card and return envelope are enclosed for your convenience, to acknowledge your acceptance of nomination, to confirm your approval of election to the Wisdom Hall Of Fame, and to express your wish to be an Eminent Recipient of the 1969 Wisdom Award. An immediate response will be appreciated by the Board of Editors. With highest esteem,

PEDIA <::An allegorical figure, possibly an angel or muse, with wings, is depicted seated on a pedestal or stack of books. She is blowing a long, slender trumpet held to her mouth. At her feet, various objects representing arts and sciences are scattered, including a painter's palette with brushes, a sculpted head, musical instruments (like a flute or recorder), and books or scrolls. : figure::> 969
